text: I am gonna show you the one cake that
you need to make all summer long for
every summer party it's a cornmeal bury
sheet cake it bakes in one layer no
frosting but beautiful berries on top
and everyone's gonna love it we start
with one and a half sticks of butter
right into the mixer let's get this
going
this is about as basic of a cake as it
gets
one and a half cups of sugar slowly pour
it in I want the sugar to incorporate in
the butter next three eggs once you see
the egg disappear add the next one we're
going to flavor it a little bit with a
little bit of vanilla extract one and a
half teaspoons now we need our dry
ingredients one and a half cups of flour
3/4 of a cup of cornmeal this is just a
regular cornmeal and this is what's
really gonna give it a little bit of
crunch 3/4 teaspoon of salt salt always
brings out every bit of flavor and one
and a half teaspoons of baking powder
that's for Lebanon now quickly whisk
this together and now this is going to
get added to the butter mixture I'm
gonna turn this down so my butter
doesn't fly everywhere and then half of
the buttermilk and the buttermilk is
just gonna add a tangy note that is so
good in a cake another third of the dry
and that's it hey so we have to scrape
down the sides and get every bit of
batter that's on the sides and make sure
there aren't any butter lumps that looks
perfect so now we have our pans this is
just a basic 9 by 13 baking pan I've
buttered it I've lined it with parchment
and I like to keep these overhangs
because this will make it easy to pull
the cake out when it's done batter goes
in
my favorite tool the little offset
spatula
this makes spreading so easy as you can
see the batter looks great it's nice and
smooth you see those little bits of
cornmeal now come the berries I have
three different kinds of berries and I'm
just gonna sprinkle them on the top if
the berries are really big like these
blackberries I've cut them in half
scatter them around blueberries and then
my favorite the raspberries and of
course these add great color as well and
these will sink in a little bit but they
will stay on top to really give you that
color two tablespoons of sugar goes over
just to give it a sparkly crunch looks
great so this goes into a 325 degree
oven for about an hour check it with a
toothpick when it's clean it's ready and
it'll be nice and golden brown our
cornmeal berry sheet cake is totally
cool it took about an hour but you could
certainly bake this in the morning for
your afternoon picnic I'm gonna use a
knife to loosen up the sides I think I'm
gonna grab a big spatula to help me pull
it out and then right onto the board can
cut this into squares I like to do 12
squares so it's in half down the middle
and then each side in half again so we
have four this way and then three this
way this is a nice generous sir
and the berries look so great they sunk
into the cake and release their juices
it's really beautiful
look how pretty that is and with very
little effort from here we can do a
little whipped cream looks so good
mmm delicious I love that cornmeal
crunch and the berries are so good be
sure to try this one
you
